events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim with all the basic details provided.
The claim was categorised under auto accident after review of the incident description and involved parties.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to the customer's case to guide them through the claims process efficiently.
Acknowledgement of the filed claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and beginning of claim processing.
The insurance company requested additional documents from the customer including police report and repair estimates.
The customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including photos, police report, and damage assessment reports.
Investigation into the collision and damages began, involving assessment by an insurance adjuster and verification of claims.
The investigation team completed their review of all evidence and damage reports, confirming liability and validity of the claim.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on the investigation findings and repair cost estimates.
The customer provided positive feedback regarding the promptness and transparency of the settlement proposal.
Approval of the claim was granted officially confirming the settlement and next steps towards payment disbursement.
The payment for the approved settlement was issued to the customerâ€™s account for repair costs covering the auto accident.
The claim was officially closed following payment completion and confirmation that all issues related to the accident were resolved.
The case files and documents were archived in the system to maintain records of the auto accident insurance claim.
